result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruben Romo Deanda

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Jade K Hall in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court upon request from the Defense.  Defendant has been deported.  State requests a bench warrant.  Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.

Attorney Jade K Hall in court, defendant Ruben Romo Deanda not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Court ordered defense to file motion by August 16, 2022.  Court scheduled a status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jade K Hall in court, defendant Ruben Romo Deanda not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a scheduling conference.  Defendant is in custody in Minnesota.  Defense requested a status date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ruben Romo Deanda in court with Attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Ruben Romo Deanda in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of a conviction in Illinois for the defendant. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Ayala. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Jade Hall

22RM024170  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/01/2022 sa

Defendant Ruben Romo Deanda not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ruben Romo Deanda in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Ruben Romo Deanda in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ruben Romo Deanda appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
